summary:
Rebalances and overhauls the Aedric Shrines (and several Daedric Blessings) to be more distinct, lore friendly, and to give more progression and responsiveness to their blessing effects.

Integrates many of Skyrim's quests into several Aedric and Daedric Blessings, giving more incentive for character development.
descriptionHtml:
[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b]R[/b][b]equiem - Immersive Divine Blessings (R-IDB[/b])[/color] modifies [color=#ffe599]Aedric Blessings[/color] (and several [color=#ffe599]Daedric Blessings[/color]) and conditions to be more distinct and lore-friendly, while giving more progression and responsiveness to PC blessing development. Also, this mod integrates many of Skyrim's quests into several [color=#fff2cc]Aedric[/color] and [color=#ffe599]Daedric Blessings[/color], giving even more incentive for character development.[/size][/font][/size][/font]
[font=Georgia][size=3]
[code][/code][font=Georgia][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87420]Requiem - Werewolf and Vampire Rebalance (W&VR)[/url] is now fully integrated into [color=#e69138][b]R-IDB[/b][/color], with further modded expansions. Do not include [color=#e69138][b]W&VR[/b][/color] in your load order when using this mod.[/size][/font]

[size=4][b]Introduction[/b][/size]

[/size][/font][code][/code][font=Georgia][size=3][spoiler]
[code]
[/code]When Xarrian created[b][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/19281]Requiem - The Oldschool Roleplaying Overhaul[/url][/b], their creative genius fixed a lot of what [b]Skyrim[/b] needed to feel like a finished game world. Some of the mechanics like [color=#ffe599]Alchemy[/color] (which I've attempted to remedy with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/86504]R-AR[/url]), [color=#ffe599]Magic[/color] (which I'm in the process of attempting to remedy), and [color=#ffe599]Aedric Blessings[/color] got the broad strokes right, but weren't fine tuned before Xarrian moved on from [b]Requiem[/b] modding. Ogerboss and the [b]Requiem[/b] team have made great strides in [b]Requiem 2.0.x [/b]regarding [color=#ffe599]Aedric Blessings[/color]. It's now less painful to edit them, and way less painful to scroll down the [color=#ffe599]Aedric Blessing[/color] effects lists to simply see what's going on there.[b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74330/?]

Requiem - Behind the Curtain[/url][/b]([b]BtC[/b])by zer0morph, and [b]BtC[/b]'s successor, [b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/81785/?]Requiem - AZ Tweaks[/url][/b] ([b]AZT[/b]) by Applesaucez have some of the best examples of a more living system of interacting with Aedra for their blessings. Although I looked at [b]Requiem[/b] record edits of the aforementioned two mods for inspiration, this mod is independently created and uses [b]Requiem 2.0.x[/b]'s new and improved [color=#ffe599]Aedric Blessing[/color] record system.[/size][/font][code][/code]
[center]﻿[font=Georgia][size=3][size=3][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/72865-2-1460144991.png[/img][/size][/size][/font][/center][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Anders[/color], the Whiterun priest of Arkay, describes his [color=#f9cb9c]Amulet of Arkay[/color] as the source of his divine powers while requesting the PC to recover it. Part of [/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]the intent of [/size][/font]this mod is to make [b]Requiem[/b] consistent with that in-game lore. Wearing the Amulet of a respective Aedra is now central to receiving their greater blessings.[/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3] Amulets of a given Aedra will now also lose their blessing if a PC acts outside of their respective blessing requirements.

[font=Georgia][size=3]Activating base [b]Requiem[/b] Shrines for lesser [color=#ffe599]Aedric Blessings[/color] will work as normal when a PC isn't wearing a corresponding Aedric Amulet, though w[/size][/font]earing a corresponding Aedric Amulet will add [font=Georgia][size=3]more potent[/size][/font] [color=#ffe599]Aedric Blessings[/color].
[/size][/font][center]﻿[font=Georgia][size=3][size=3][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/72865-2-1460144991.png[/img][/size][/size][/font][/center][font=Georgia][size=3]In base [b]Requiem[/b], Aedra follow mostly identical conditions for blessings.

[spoiler]

[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]No current crime bounties.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Less than 3000 lifetime crime bounty for greater blessings, or less than 6000 with the perk Painful Regrets for Cure Disease only.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Less than 10 stolen items for greater blessings, or less than 20 [font=Georgia][size=3]with the perk Painful Regrets for Cure Disease only.[/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Less than 1 murder for greater blessings, or less than 3 [font=Georgia][size=3]with the perk [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Painful Regrets for Cure Disease only[/size][/font][/size][/font].[/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Not finished the Dark Brotherhood quest "With Friends Like These..."[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Not finished the Thieves Guild quest "Taking Care of Business"[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3]
Some base [b]Requiem[/b] Aedra have a few individual additional conditions as well.

[font=Georgia][size=3][/spoiler][/size][/font]
[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][size=3][color=#e69138][b][size=3]R-IDB[/size][/b][/color][/size][/size][/font] Aedra have more individual lore-based [color=#ffe599]Aedric Blessing[/color] requirements. Some require more than others, some require very little, and most Aedra's conditions for greater blessings are different.[/size][/font]

Most base [b]Requiem[/b] greater [color=#ffe599]Aedric Blessing[/color] buffs only kick in after a PC has accomplished a considerable amount of grinding for a given Aedra. [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][size=3][color=#e69138][b][size=3]R-IDB[/size][/b][/color][/size][/size][/font][/size][/font] [color=#ffe599]Aedric Blessing[/color] buffs increase incrementally based on incrementally satisfying their Aedric desires.

[font=Georgia][size=3][size=3][color=#e69138][b][size=3]R-IDB[/size][/b][/color][/size][/size][/font] Aedric Shrine blessings all last for 36 Earth hours / 15 Nirn days (up from 24 Earth hours / 10 Nirn days in base [b]Requiem[/b]) to allow a PC a more reasonable time limit to delve into quests without having to back out part way through due to blessing time limits expiring. The standard limit for murders before most Aedra refuse to bless a PC has also been raised (from 0 in base [b]Requiem)[/b] to 2, and much more for a few Aedra. Aedra recognize that Tamriel is a violent and often chaotic place, where the difference between killing and murder can sometimes become blurred, so long as a PC doesn't turn out to be a murderhobo.

The perk [color=#ffe599]Painful Regrets[/color] has been renamed [color=#ffe599]Aedric Realignment[/color]. This better reflects that different PCs may have very different reasons for taking on Aedric adherency, which may have nothing to do with regret. If the [color=#ffe599]Aedric Realignment[/color] perk becomes available in the Restoration tree, it indicates that the PC has lost favor with at least one Aedra, but not necessarily all of them. [font=Georgia][size=3]Each Aedra in [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][size=3][color=#e69138][b][size=3]R-IDB[/size][/b][/color][/size][/size][/font][/size][/font] has different respective commands for their adherents.[/size][/font] There's no need to invest in the [color=#ffe599][font=Georgia][size=3]Aedric Realignment[/size][/font][/color] perk to receive shrine blessings if the PC adheres to a given Aedra's commands and they remain in good standing with them.

Since many Aedric Amulets can be difficult to consistently find in-game, three jewelers in Skyrim now sell a small number of them. These are mainly Amulets of the Aedric Shrines present in each of their respective cities. The Jewelers are [color=#f9cb9c]Fralia Gray-Mane[/color] in Whiterun, [color=#f9cb9c]Madesi[/color] in Riften, and [color=#f9cb9c]Kerah[/color] in Markarth. I've added the respective Amulets to their leveled lists. Any other mod that changes their leveled lists could be incompatible, though these are such minor NPCs that I doubt any other mods affect them. Let me know if otherwise.

Mara and Stendarr now truly offer the PC compassion and mercy by giving them a second chance to earn greater blessings when investing in the [color=#ffe599]Aedric Realignment[/color] perk, provided the PC hasn't transgressed too severely.

[/spoiler]
[center][font=Georgia][size=3][size=3][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/72865-2-1460144991.png[/img][/size][/size][/font]﻿[/center][size=5][url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Akatosh]Akatosh[/url][/size] – The Dragon God of Time and chief god of the pantheon.
[/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][i]"Akatosh says: Serve and obey your Emperor. Study the Covenants. Worship the Nine, do your duty, and heed the commands of the saints and priests."[/i] ― [url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Ten_Commands:_Nine_Divines]Ten Commands: Nine Divines[/url][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3]

Akatosh is the chief deity of the Imperial Cult and its Eight or Nine Divines. This deity is formed from the compromise between Aui-El of the Mer races, Bormah of the dragons, and possibly others, during the first Era when Alessia formed the first Cyrodilic Empire. Alduin is Akatosh/Bormah's [/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]first born and main adversary, threatening the [/size][/font]existence of self/time. Dragons serving Alduin are disloyal to Akatosh's will. Adherents who fight to end the Skyrim dragon crisis earn the greater blessings of Akatosh.

[b]Blessing Conditions[/b]

[spoiler]

[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Receiving greater blessings requires wearing an [color=#f9cb9c]Amulet of Akatosh[/color].[/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]No current crime bounties.[/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Less than 3000 lifetime crime bounty for greater blessings, or less than 10,000 with the perk Aedric Realignment for Cure Disease only.[/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Less than 10 stolen items [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]for greater blessings[/size][/font][/size][/font], or less than 20 [font=Georgia][size=3]with the perk [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Aedric Realignment[/size][/font][/size][/font] for Cure Disease only.[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Less than 10 pickpocketed items for greater blessings, [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]or less than 20 [font=Georgia][size=3]with the perk [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Aedric Realignment for Cure Disease only[/size][/font][/size][/font].[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Committed less than 3 murders for greater blessings, or less than 5 [font=Georgia][size=3]with the perk [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Aedric Realignment for Cure Disease only[/size][/font][/size][/font].[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Not finished the Dark Brotherhood quest [color=#f9cb9c]With Friends Like These...[/color][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Not finished the Thieves Guild quest [color=#f9cb9c]Taking Care of Business[/color][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]PC is not a vampire.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]PC is not a werewolf.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]PC has no Daedric artifacts, weapons, or armor, including the Necromancer's Amulet. [/size][/font]
[/list]
[font=Georgia][size=3][/spoiler][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3]
[b]Greater Shrine Blessings[/b]

[spoiler]

Absorbing dragon souls increases the following blessing magnitudes from [color=#f9cb9c]Shrines of Akatosh[/color]:

[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3](Oblivion Lore) [color=#ffe599]Jaws of Akatosh: Fortify Speed[/color]: incrementally increases by +2.5% for every 5 dragon souls absorbed[font=Georgia][size=3], up to a maximum of +25% after absorbing at least 50 dragon souls.[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][size=3][font=Georgia][color=#ffe599]Bormahu Yol[/color]: creates a constant area effect that causes damage to disloyal dragons and those who serve them. Starts at 2 damage/second, increasing in power every 10 dragon souls absorbed, and maxes out at 6 damage/second after absorbing at least 30 dragon souls.[/font][/size]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3]
Every Main Quest completed, starting with [color=#f9cb9c]Bleak Falls Barrow[/color], incrementally increases the following blessing magnitudes [font=Georgia][size=3]from [color=#f9cb9c]Shrines of Akatosh[/color]:[/size][/font]

[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599][color=#ffffff](Skyrim Lore)[/color] Regenerate Magicka[/color]: incrementally increases by +25%, up to a maximum of +250% after 18 Main Quests completed (and additionally +25% from an [color=#f9cb9c]Amulet of Akatosh[/color]).[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Regenerate Stamina[/color]: incrementally increases by +20%, up to a maximum of +100% after 16 Main Quests completed.[/size][/font][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]
[/size][/font][/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Regenerate Health[/color]: incrementally increases by +0.25 [color=#ffe599]Health[/color] recovery/second, up to a maximum of +1.25 [color=#ffe599]Health[/color] recovery/second after 17 Main Quests completed.[/size][/font][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3]
The base [b]Requiem[/b] Fortify [color=#ffe599]Health/Magicka/Stamina[/color] buff for killing Alduin is retained, though the three buffs are reduced to +50 each (from +100 each in base [b]Requiem[/b]).

[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]You can tell when [color=#ffe599]Bormahu Yol[/color] is active, both from the active effects menu and by the minor visual effect it creates, which is identical to the one used by base [b]Requiem[/b] for the Restoration spell [color=#ffe599]Healing Aura[/color]. The effect is otherwise invisible - until you walk up close to hostile dragons and their worshipers.[/size][/font][/size][/font]

[/spoiler]
[center]﻿[font=Georgia][size=3][size=3][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/72865-2-1460144991.png[/img][/size][/size][/font][/center][size=5][url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Arkay]Arkay[/url][/size] – God of the Cycle of Life, Death, Mortals burials, and funeral rites.
[i]"Arkay says: Honor the earth, its creatures, and the spirits, living and dead. Guard and tend the bounties of the mortal
world, and do not profane the spirits of the dead."[/i] ― [url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Ten_Commands:_Nine_Divines]Ten Commands: Nine Divines[/url]

Arkay's order protect souls from manipulation. Arkay loosely opposes Daedric Princes, but only because Daedra claim the souls of those who align with them, removing those souls from Arkay's protection in Aetherius (or each racially based afterlife). Arkay bestows increased [color=#ffe599]Health[/color] on adherents who follow his principles, as well as [color=#ffe599]Health,[/color] [color=#ffe599]Magicka[/color], and aid in cleansing undead, to adherents who oppose necromancy and the undead.

[font=Georgia][size=3][b]Blessing Conditions[/b]

[font=Georgia][size=3][spoiler]

[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Receiving greater blessings requires wearing an [color=#f9cb9c]Amulet of Arkay[/color].[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Arkay is not concerned with crime bounties, stolen items, or pickpocketing. They have no bearing on souls.[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Committed less than 3 murders for greater blessings, or less than 5 [font=Georgia][size=3]with the perk [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Aedric Realignment for Cure Disease only[/size][/font][/size][/font].[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Not finished the Dark Brotherhood quest [color=#f9cb9c]With Friends Like These...[/color][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Not finished the Thieves Guild quest [color=#f9cb9c]Taking Care of Business[/color].[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Brother Verulus from Markarth must remain alive.[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]

[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]PC is not a vampire.[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]PC is not a werewolf.[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]PC has no Daedric artifacts, including the Necromancer's Amulet.[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Trapped less than 3 souls in soul gems for greater blessings, or less than 5 with the perk Aedric Realignment for Cure Disease only.[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]PC has no Conjuration perks related to Necromancy and has learned no Conjuration spells related to necromancy.[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]
[/spoiler][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]
[b]Greater Shrine Blessings[/b][/size][/font]

[spoiler]

Every 20 undead laid to rest incrementally [font=Georgia][size=3]and alternating[/size][/font] increases the following blessing magnitudes from Shrines of Arkay when the PC wears an [color=#ffe599]Amulet of Arkay[/color]:
[/size][/font]
[list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Fortify Health[/color]: incrementally increases by +20, up to a maximum of +140 after 220 or more undead are laid to rest (and additionally +10 [color=#ffe599]Fortify Health[/color] from an [color=#f9cb9c]Amulet of Arkay[/color]).[/size][/font]
[/list]
[list]
[*][size=3][font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][color=#ffffff][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Arkay's Cleansing[/color]: area effect that continuously burns hostile undead and necromancers (no other NPCs are affected) in close proximity to the adherent of Arkay for the duration of the blessing. The area effect buff starts at 0.4 damage/second with a small chance to stagger affected NPCs, and incrementally increases up to a maximum of 2.4 damage/second after 200 or more undead are laid to rest. Beware having this blessing active when interacting with quest-giving undead NPCs, as this will lay them to rest if they turn hostile.[/size][/font][/color][/color][/font][/size]
[/list][size=3][font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][color=#ffffff][font=Georgia][size=3]
[/size][/font][/color][/color][/font][/size][list]
[*][size=3][font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][color=#ffffff][font=Georgia][size=3]You can tell when [color=#ffe599]Arkay's Cleansing[/color] is active, both from the active effects menu and by the minor visual effect it creates, which is identical to the one used by base [b]Requiem[/b] for the Restoration spell Healing Aura. The effect is otherwise invisible - until you walk up close to undead and they catch on fire.[/size][/font][/color][/color][/font][/size]
[/list][size=3][font=Georgia][color=#ffe599]
Fortify Magicka[/color]: granted for completing the following quests, or for clearing out the following Necromancer locations (which can be connected to random quests):[/font][/size]

Auri-El is the chief of most Aldmeri pantheons, and the majority of Altmer and Bosmer claim direct descendency from him. [url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/The_Alduin/Akatosh_Dichotomy]Though priests of Akatosh in the Imperial Cult may claim otherwise[/url], Auri-El has [url=http://en.uesp.net/wiki/Lore:Auri-El]long-standing animosity with Lorkan/Shor for tricking him into participating in the creation of Mundus, severing the Mer from the spirit worlds[/url]. Auri-El furthermore has animosity with Kyne for [url=http://en.uesp.net/wiki/Lore:Kyne]creating the Nords at the Throat of the World[/url], who [url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Nord]settled Atmora and later returned to slaughter and drive the Mer out of much of Tamriel during the Merethic Era[/url]. Auri-El has little care for the lower caste [url=http://en.uesp.net/wiki/Lore:Dunmer]Mer tribes cursed and transformed by Azura into Dunmer, who have largely given up Aedra worship in favor of worshipping Daedra[/url]. Auri-El cares little for [url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Trinimac][font=Georgia][size=3]Trinimac[/size][/font]'s cursed Mer tribes since [font=Georgia][size=3]Boethiah[/size][/font] transformed them into Malacath and Orcs[/url]. Though Auri-El and Akatosh are different beings representing the same Time, they exist within the Dragon of Time, which occurs in [url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Dragon_Break]multiple times and forms simultaneously overlapping[/url].

Though Auri-El has no love for the races of Men, Beasts, or the lower castes of Mer, he acts without grudge. He finds no reason to deny minor benefits to those who are not his children if they serve his purposes. This is not true for Nords though, as any benefit to Nords gives strength to [url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Dawn_Era]his enemies in the long lasting war over Mundus he and Anui-El have waged with Sithis, Shor/Lorkhan, and Kyne[/url].

[font=Georgia][size=3]Alduin is a threat to Auri-El's supremacy[/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3], challenging the [/size][/font]existence of self/time, while dragons serving Alduin are disloyal to Auri-El's will. Though Auri-El and his Mer followers seek to end Mundus and its control over them, they want to do so on their own terms. [font=Georgia][size=3]Altmer and Bosmer adherents who fight to end the Skyrim dragon crisis earn the greater blessings of Auri-El. 5/17/2018:

- Akatosh - reduced buff progression conditions from every 5 dragon souls absorbed to every 3, maxing out at +100% stamina rate at/above 51, +500% regeneration rate at/above 54, +40% movement rate at/above 57, and +225% magicka regen at/above 60.

- Auri-El - reduced buff progression conditions from every 5 dragon souls absorbed to every 3, maxing out at +40% movement rate at/above 51, +250% magicka regen rate at/above 54, +125% stamina rate at/above 57, and +40 Fortify Marksmanship at/above 60.

- Julianos - added a magicka buff for learning spells:
- now every 20 books adds +5 magicka, up to +60 at or above 120 books read (including minor Shrine and Amulet blessings).
- now every 5 spells learned adds +5 magicka up to +100 magicka at or above 100 spells learned.

- Kynareth - reduced location discovery requirements for gaining buffs from every 25 to every 14:
- resist poison now maxes at 98% at/after 168 locations discovered.
- fortify stamina now maxes at 105 at/after 182 locations discovered.

- Stendarr - reduced buff progression conditions from every 5 daedra killed to every 3, maxing out at -50% restoration spell cost at 39, +25 melee at 42, and +80% block at 45 (including +10% block from Amulet of Standarr).

- Talos - reduced buff progression conditions from every 10 quests completed to every 6, maxing out at +120 carry weight at/above 90, +40 melee damage at/above 96, and 30% shout cooldown reduction at 102.
- shout cooldown buff reduced to at maximum 30% reduction at/after 102 quests completed (including 10% for the Amulet blessing).
- added in a carry weight buff, +15 per cycle of alternating blessings, up to +120 at/after 90 quests completed.

- Nocturnal - added lockpicking expertise buffs for picking locks, +10 per 25 locks picked, up to +50 at/after 125.
- added pickpocketing buffs for pickpocketing, +10% per 50 sucessful pickpockets, up to +50% at/after 250.

- Arkay - bug fix from initial testing that made Arkay's Cleansing area effect occur instead of (rather than concurrent with) Fortify Health when first acquired from his shrine.

- Added hostile NPCs with the perks Necromancy, Ritualism, and/or Dark Souls to those affected by Arkay's Cleansing. This should affect all hostile necromancer NPCs.

- Kynareth - added Kynareth's Peace area effect buff when a PC wears an Amulet of Kynareth and visits her shrine. Kynareth's Peace reduces attack damage a little over 70% from aggressive Mudcrabs, Wolves, Bears, and Sabre Cats when they're near the PC. This can be viewed as the animals becoming more docile and play fighting. A greater version is added for bringing a sapling back to the temple of Kynareth in Whiterun, which reduces attack damage a little over 80% from all aggressive wild animals close to the PC (this includes those listed previously as well as Mammoths, Horkers, Chaurus', Frostbite Spiders, Deer, Elk, Skeevers, Goats, and all Slaughterfish). An even greater version, which additionally reduces attack damage a little over 90% from all listed wild animals as well as nearby aggressive Spriggans, is added when the PC has brought a sapling back to the temple of Kynareth in Whiterun and discovered 140 or more locations.

- Mara - added Mara's Warmth area effect buff when a PC wears an Amulet of Mara and visits her shrine. This buff constantly minorly heals friendly NPCs close to the PC by 1 Health and Stamina per second. A stronger version is added for becoming an Agent of Mara, or for destroying the Skull of Corruption, which constantly heals nearby friendly NPCs by 2 Health and Stamina per second. An even stronger healing version is added when a PC both becomes an Agent of Mara and destroys the Skull of Corruption, which constantly heals nearby friendly NPCs by 4 Health and Stamina per second.

- Stendarr - added Stendarr's Justice area effect buff when a PC wears an Amulet of Stendarr and visits his shrine. This buff damages hostile Daedra and all hostile NPCs who consort with them when near the PC by 20 magic damage/second. This include Atronachs, Dremora, Xivilai, Forsworn, Hagravens, Werewolves, Vampires, as well as any hostile NPCs with Conjuration perks beyond the first, or Conjuration skill above 30. files.changelogHtml:

-Kynareth's Protection area effect now affects all animals for all versions. Damage reduction from animals is now 25% for the lesser version, 50% for the Greater version, and 75% for the Champion version. Lesser version is granted after at least 70 locations found. Greater version is granted after PC brings back a sapling to Whiterun. Champion version is granted after PC brings back a sapling to Whiterun and at least 140 locations found.

Kyne:
- Offers greater blessings if the PC has less than 20 murders.
- Refuses blessings if PC is a Mer race (except Dunmer), has Auriel's Shield or Bow, has Volendrung, has Orcish or Elven or Glass weapons or armor, Ulfric Stormcloak is dead, or PC kills Paarthurnax.
- Greater blessings are not available to Mer races except Dunmer.
- PCs activating Shrines of Kynareth while wearing Kyne's Token recieve lightning and frost damage with Auriel's Bow or Shield, Volendrung, if Ulfric Stormcloak is dead, if PC kills Paarthurnax, or if PC is a Mer race (except Dunmer).
- Tolerates lycanthropes for greater blessings in her respect for the canine archetype represented in her deceased husband Shor/Lorkhan, and respects lycanthropes abilities as hunters if kept under control, though refuses blessings for PCs who meet with Hircine.
- PCs can recieve full blessings as members of the Thieves Guild, as long as they don't take the oath of a Nightengale.
- Allows PCs full access to The Dark Brotherhood questline, as Sithis originally created her deceased husband Shor/Lorkhan in order to free all of Sithis' creation from enslavement by Aedra.

- Fortify Endurance - Fortifies both Health and Stamina:
- Every Companions quest completed increases Fortify Endurance by +5, up to a maximum of +60 after completing at least 12 Companions quests.
- Completing the quest Soverngarde (the quest just before the final battle with Alduin) grants +30 Fortify Endurance.
- If PC is a Nord, +10 Fortify Endurance.

- Fortify Marksman - Marksmanship damage increases by +3% for every 40 animals killed, up to a maximum of +15% after killing at least 200 animals (and additionally +5% Marksmanship from Kyne's Token). If PCs kill 800 or more animals they lose access to this blessing.

- Regenerate Stamina - blessing that regenerates Stamina, granted for completing the following quests or having the following items equipped when activating a Shrine of Kynareth:
- Hunter and Hunted (at Moss Mother Cavern from Valdr) for +10% Stamina regeneration.
- The Blessings of Nature for bringing back a sapling to Whiterun (in Whiterun from Danica) for +20% Stamina regeneration.
- PC having Wuuthrad equipped when visiting a Shrine of Kynareth raises Stamina regeneration by +20%.
- PC having the Poacher's Axe equipped when visiting a Shrine of Kynareth raises Stamina regeneration by 10%.
- PC having the Woodsman's Friend equipped when visiting a Shrine of Kynareth raises Stamina regeneration by 10%.
- PC having the Bow of the Hunt equipped when visiting a Shrine of Kynareth raises Stamina regeneration by 15%.
- If PC is a Nord, raises Stamina regeneration by +10%.

- Fortify Shouts - When PC wears Kyne's Token, +3% reduction for every (three word) Shout mastered, up to a maximum of +30% after 10 Shouts mastered.
- If PC is a Nord, +10% Fortify Shouts.

- Resist Storms - provides Shock resistance and twice that to Frost resistance for completing the following quests:
- The Way of the Voice for +5% Resist Storms.
- The Horn of Jurgen Windcaller for +5% Resist Storms.
- The Throat of the World for +5% Resist Storms.
- Alduin's Bane for +5% Resist Storms.
- Soverngarde for +5% Resist Storms.
- A total of +25% Resist Storms can be gained by completing all requied quests.

- Kiss at the End - gives the PC +15% movement speed and Shout Recovery when they gain access to Soverngarde at the end of the quest The World-Eater's Eyrie.

- Voice of the Sky - animals will neither run nor attack the PC. Requires a PC to bring a sapling back to the temple of Kynareth in the quest Blessings of Nature (in Whiterun from Danica), complete the quest Hunter and Hunted (at Moss Mother Cavern from Valdr), and hunt at least 100 animals, but less than 800.

Mara:
- Bond of Matrimony - gives a constant 0.25 Health/second regeneration when wearing a wedding ring.
- Fortify Restoration now increases by +4% per 25 Restoration skill, maxing out at +24% at/after 100 Restoration skill.
- Mara's Warmth area effect now progesses as 1, 2, and 3 respectively.

Molag Bal:
- PC vampires and use of the Necromancer's Amulet are debuffed if the PC is an Agent of Mara or Dibella (it disgusts Molag Bal), or has completed Meridia's Daedric Quest (she has claim over the PC's soul). Molag Bal's Daedric Quest will be extremely difficult to complete if any of those conditions are met as well.
- The Necromancer's Amulet has minor extra disincentives to use if the PC isn't undead.

Sanguine:
- Easter Eggs and secret content will not be listed here.
- Likes: Clavicus Vile, Mephala, Peryite, and Dibella. Ruining marriages. Those who have the virility of horses. Brawls and pugilism. Pulp literature. Heavy drunkenness, skooma intoxication, or having at least a few skooma to offer. Nudity.
- Dislikes: Affiliating with worshippers of almost any of the Divines, except Dibella. Worshipping Mara or becoming her Agent will severely disappoint Sanguine. Completing the quest "The Raid".
- Taking all of your armor/clothes off or puting any on will often create different effects while the Sanguine Rose is activated. Taking clotes off often makes people/mer/dremora appear. Putting clothes on often makes animals appear.
- No effects will usually take place if the PC isn't intoxicated by alcohol or skooma, or doesn't have at least a few skooma on hand.

Stendarr:
- PCs can now kill up to 9 NPCs before initially losing greater blessings (and up to 11 with Aedric Realignment) to make up for the seven murders required to complete the Greater Blessing Daedric quests.

- Fortify Restortion buff for clearing the following vampire locations, or completing the following quest:
- Clear Broken Fang Cave for +4%.
- Clear Haemer's Shame for +4%.
- Clear Mara's Eye Pond for +4%.
- Clear Moldering Ruins for +4%.
- Clear Movarth's Lair for +4%.
- Clear Pinemoon Cave for +4%.
- Clear Redwater Den for +4%.
- Clear Shriekwind Bastion for +4%.
- Clear Bloodlet Throne for +4%.
- The Wolf Queen Awakened (in Solitude from Falk) for +8% Fortify Restoration.
- A total of +44% Fortify Restoration can be gained at a Shrine of Stendarr when all conditions are completed.

- Fortify Melee buff for the following Daedric quests:
- The House of Horrors (in Markarth from Vigilant Tyranus). End this quest by killing Logrolf after the quest begins, without returning him to Molag Bal's shrine, for +8% Fortify Melee.
- Waking Nightmare (in Dawnstar from Erandur). Destroy the Skull of Corruption for +8% Fortify Melee.
- The Taste of Death (in Markarth from Eola). End the quest by killing Eola when you understand her to serve Daedra after the quest begins for +3% Fortify Melee.
- Pieces of the Past (in Dawnstar from Silus). End the quest by killing Silus when you understand him to serve Daedra - before retrieving the pieces of the blade- after the quest begins for +3% Fortify Melee.
- Ending the Daedric quest Discerning the Transmundane now gives the PC +8% Fortify Melee (up from +3% in v1.10) since it requires delving into Blackreach for the Elder Scroll and Lexicon to get to a point where killing Septimus is relevant (and where the game engine allows the PC to kill Septimus).
- Kill Kesh at Peryite's Shirne for +3%.
- Kill Aranea at Azura's Shirne for +3%.
- A total of +40% Fortify Melee can be gained at a shrine of Stendarr when all conditions are completed.

- Completing Dawnguard quests (while not a vampire) and wearing an Amulet of Stendarr allows the following shrine blessings:
- Fortify Health: +10 per alternating cycle of completed Dawnguard quests, maxing out at +50 at/after 13 quests completed.
- Fortify Stamina: +10 per alternating cycle of completed Dawnguard quests, maxing out at +50 at/after 14 quests completed.
- Fortify Restoration Strength: +5% per alternating cycle of completed Dawnguard quests, maxing out at +25% at/after 15 quests completed.
- Stendarr's Justice now sequentially buffs damage area effect to 8, 16, and 24 respectively.

Talos:
- Completing the quest The Ghost of old Hrolden (in Old Hrolden Inn from Eydis) grants the PC +10 Health.
- Completing The Wolf Queen Awakened now grants +15 Health.
- Completing the quest Missing in Action (in Whiterun from Fralia or Avulstein) grants the PC +15 Stamina.
- PCs can now kill up to 9 NPCs before losing greater blessings to make up for the potential vanilla Skyrim murder bugs during Civil War quests.

Improved the coding for Kynareth's Peace to run more efficiently.
Integrated in the functionality from Werewolf and Vampire Rebalance 3.2.
Fixed a bug allowing PCs under certain conditions to keep previous shrine blessings when activating another shrine for blessings, or to multiply blessings from a single shrine by repeatedly activating it.
Matched all Daedric Artifact weights and to their normal Daedric or Ebony weapon and armor counterparts.
Improved Sanguine Rose, Hircine's Ring and it's relationship to werewolves, the Necromancer's Amulet's relationship to the living and the undead, and the Mace of Molag Bal and its relationship to vampires.

files.name: Requiem - Immersive Divine Blessings 1.12
files.changelogHtml:
8/28/2018:

Thanks to llanga for the stagger effect inspiration on Arkay and Stendarr's area effects.

Fixed a couple of bugs involving Sanguine Rose blessing conditions.

- Arkay's Cleansing now sequentially buffs undead damage area effect to 0.4, 0.8, 1.2, 1, 1.6, 2, and 2.4 respectively. Now has a low random percent chance of staggering as well.
- PC debuffs are less severe and better balanced.

Stendarr: - Stendarr's Justice now sequentially buffs damage area effect to 1, 2, and 3 respectively. Now has a low random percent chance of staggering as well.
- Player debuffs are less severe and better balanced.
- Fortify Melee buff for the following Daedric quests:
- The House of Horrors (in Markarth from Vigilant Tyranus). End this quest by killing Logrolf after the quest begins, without returning him to Molag Bal's shrine, for +5% Fortify Melee.
- Waking Nightmare (in Dawnstar from Erandur). Destroy the Skull of Corruption for +5% Fortify Melee.
- Ending the Daedric quest Discerning the Transmundane now gives the PC +5% Fortify Melee since it requires delving into Blackreach for the Elder Scroll and Lexicon to get to a point where killing Septimus is relevant (and where the game engine allows the PC to kill Septimus).
- Destroy the Dark Bortherhood (from any Hold Guard after killing Astrid) for +5%
- The Taste of Death (in Markarth from Eola). End the quest by killing Eola when you understand her to serve Daedra after the quest begins for +2.5% Fortify Melee.
- Pieces of the Past (in Dawnstar from Silus). End the quest by killing Silus when you understand him to serve Daedra - before retrieving the pieces of the blade- after the quest begins for +2.5% Fortify Melee.
- Kill Kesh at Peryite's Shrine for +2.5%.
- Kill Aranea at Azura's Shrine for +2.5%.

- Akatosh: - Fortify Speed now starts at +2.5% after 5 dragon souls absorbed, increasing +2.5% per 5 dragon souls absorbed, and maxes out at +25% at/after 50 dragon souls absorbed.
- Bormahu Yol now sequentially buffs dragon damage area effect to 2, 3, 4, and 6 respectively.

- Auri-El: - Fortify Speed now starts at +5% after 5 dragon souls absorbed, increasing +5% per 5 dragon souls absorbed, and maxes out at +50% at/after 50 dragon souls absorbed.

- Talos - Destroy the Dark Brotherhood! (from any Hold Guard after killing Astrid) now grants +15 Stamina.

- Zenithar: - PC debuffs are less severe and better balanced.
